page.title: 04RIDINGS MEAD , SALISBURY
page.content: Ridings Mead is a new smart housing estate. Houses range with bedrooms from 1-4. There is a big house which was part of an old peoples home called Meyrick Close. Each house has a garden, but you don't know whether it is a front or back garden, because there is a path on each side of the house. There are lots of short cuts & paths. Most of the houses have garages. There are also sidewalks going from one backroad to another. There are street lights, a pillar box & two small playgrounds. The houses are made of brick with concrete tiles. Most houses have fireplaces & they all have gas & electricty. The estate was completed in 1985 on the site of The Alderbury Union Workhouse. The chapel is a free church but it used to be the workhouse chapel.
